alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 5:32PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in southern New Jersey...Burlington and Camden. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Bensalem, Willingboro, Lumberton, Burlington, Mount Holly, Riverside, Palmyra, Jenkintown, Beverly, and Rockledge. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 5. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 349 and 351. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 22 and 38. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 338 and 340. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 37 and 49. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 3 and 4. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
